intro: Miliusa nilagirica, commonly known as the Nilagiri miliusa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance, while its fruits are small, fleshy drupes. Miliusa nilagirica is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
